intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion leucophaeum subsp. diabolinum, commonly known as the white-hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-white, woolly leaves and yellow ray flowers. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. It produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal, aiding in its spread. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
